headline: Spotify Wrapped gets the AI treatment through Google partnership
summary: It's that time of year again, and no, I'm not talking about the holiday season or the post-Thanksgiving gym session. Spotify Wrapped is back (SPOT) to remind music lovers of their most listened-to songs and favorite artists from this past year, and it wouldn't be 2024 without a smidge of AI thrown in there. Steven Johnson, the Head of Editorial at Google Labs (GOOG, GOOGL), joins Josh Lipton and Akiko Fujita to talk about the AI partnership with Spotify to build out an AI-generated podcast to accompany users' Wrapped experience, built with Google NotebookLM. "The software effectively looks at your listening history, it knows a little bit about the kind of the artists in question and their... records and their sensibility... and it turns that into this kind of playful banter, discussing what was interesting about your year in music," Johnson tells Yahoo Finance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Spotify's stock price is 'absurd': Analyst
summary: Spotify Technology (SPOT) reported better-than-expected third quarter earnings and issued an upbeat outlook, sending the music platform's shares higher. However, New Constructs CEO David Trainer cautions that Spotify's stock surge proves the company's valuation is overextended. "Valuation has to matter at some point," Trainer tells Catalysts, noting that to justify Spotify's current stock price, the music streaming platform would need to reach revenues of approximately $650 billion — nearly double the size of the entire music streaming industry. "It is absurd how expensive the stock is," Trainer states. From an investment perspective, he believes Spotify's share price poses a substantial risk, warning that "a stock this expensive is a huge risk because when the music stops, pun intended, the downside here is enormous." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Spotify forecasts profit above estimates on cost cuts, steady user growth
summary: (Reuters) -Audio-streaming giant Spotify forecast fourth-quarter profit above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, betting on cost cuts and strong subscriber growth in the crucial holiday season.  It has also raised prices of its plans in the U.S. to capitalize on demand for its premium products.  Spotify expects operating income of 481 million euros ($509.76 million) in the fourth quarter, compared with the LSEG-compiled average analysts' estimate of 445.7 million euros.

headline: Spotify Posts Third Consecutive Quarterly Profit
summary: Spotify posted a third consecutive quarterly profit and is on track to be in the black for the full year for the first time.  After years of rapid subscriber growth and efforts to expand beyond music streaming into broader audio offerings such as podcasts and audiobooks, the company has more recently focused on controlling costs and prioritizing profits.  Spotify earned a quarterly profit of €300 million in the September quarter, up from €65 million a year ago.
